H0.text: Nova is the intensely bright object formed when a star explodes.

H1.text: Red giant is the intensely bright object formed when a star explodes.

H2.text: Supernova is the intensely bright object formed when a star explodes.

H3.text: White dwarf is the intensely bright object that is formed when a star explodes.

A4.text: A nova is a transient astronomical event that causes the sudden appearance of a bright, apparently 'new' star (hence the name 'nova', Latin for 'new') that slowly fades over weeks or months.

A5.text: Eventually, the white dwarf can explode as a Type Ia supernova if it approaches the Chandrasekhar limit.
